title: Brian K. Vaughan's Saga And Ex Machina Omnibuses Are Nearly 50% Off At Amazon
description: The beloved sci-fi graphic novel series Saga is on sale as part of Amazon's Cyber Monday event. You can pick up the Saga Box Set: Volumes 1-9 for $67.44--a nearly 50% discount compared to its normal $125 list price. Alternatively, you can get a single-volume paperback compendium of Volumes 1-9 for $33.56, which is also nearly a 50% discount from its $60 list price. This doorstopper of a book is 1,328 pages. Get box set at Amazon Get compendium at Amazon Written by Brian K. Vaughan and illustrated by Fiona Staples, Saga tells the tale of two lovers--Marko and Alana--who fight on opposing sides of a galactic war but desert their posts to be together and now must live as planet-hopping fugitives. The setting mixes sci-fi elements like robots and starships with fantasy and magic, while grounding it all with humanistic drama and humor. The ongoing series debuted in 2012 and remains among the best-selling and acclaimed modern comics series.Saga Box Set: Volumes 1-9If you've ever been curious about Saga or are looking for some well-written comics aimed at older readers, this box set deal is the perfect chance to pick up most of the series in one collection. The box set includes the first nine volumes of the story, which will catch you up with most of the story so far. From there, you can pick up Volumes 10 and 11, both of which are also on sale and eligible for Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free sale on select books and Blu-rays.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get Awesome Meta Quest 3S Or Quest 3 Deal At Amazon Ahead Of Cyber Monday
description: Meta Quest 3S with $75 gift card $299 See at Amazon See at Target Meta Quest 3 with $75 Amazon Credit $500 See at Amazon See at Best Buy One of the best Black Friday gaming deals is still available as Cyber Monday promotions are starting to take over. The Meta Quest 3S comes with a free $75 digital gift card at Amazon and Target. This is an incredible deal, as the Quest 3S just released on October 15. The $299 VR headset is the best entry-level standalone headset you can buy. In addition to the $75 gift card, you'll also get Meta's awesome promotion: The Quest 3S is bundled with Batman: Arkham Shadow, a new action game that's exclusive to the Quest 3S and Quest 3, and three months of Quest+, which gets you six more free games to keep.The same promotion is now being offered for the $500 Quest 3 headset as a Doorbuster deal at Best Buy. Unsurprisingly, Amazon is matching the promotion, so you can get $75 of Amazon credit when purchasing the Quest 3, too. The Quest 3 also includes Batman: Arkham Shadow and three months of Quest+.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2's first big patch is out with 650 fixes for crashes, progress blocks, physics and AI bugs
description: Is your Zone more Anomaly-rich than it should be? Are your corpses uncannily airborne? Do your comrades have dodgy teeth, and not in a good way? Do bits of your HUD keep disappearing? Be of good cheer, for GSC Game World have released the first proper S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2: Heart Of Chornbyl update, which patches out over 650 different bugs and issues. These range from more significant problems such as crashing and progression-blockers in certain missions, to relatively negligible stuff like wonky NPC voice volume during storms. Read more

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 858
description: Soâ€¦what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isnâ€™t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. Itâ€™s just a list of more or less random questions Iâ€™ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Stuffing or mashed potatoes? Both speak volumes to my carb-loving heart, but I love mashed potatoes just a little bit more. 2. Apple pie or apple cider? Um, both? 3. Do you have any Thanksgiving day traditions? Not really, although I do short circuit if I donâ€™t get at least one slice of pecan pie. I gotta have it! 4. Have you ever hosted Thanksgiving? Yes, a handful of times, and yes, there was pecan pie. HAHAHA! 5. Something youâ€™re thankful for? So thankful to spend time with my little family of El Hub, Connor, Rosie and Marnie. Our house is full and so is my heart! Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen P.S. Here are the questions to copy/paste with your answers in a comment. title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839
description: As most people know, Tabs was a demanding employer. He was also very fair to his employees. More than generous, actually. In keeping with his holiday traditions, Rosie allowed us to take the next two weeks off (thank you so much, Rosie!). Consequently, the employees of Tabs the Cat Industries, LLC have been up to their vacation shenanigans, which for me meant blogging while dressed up as a cat lady lumberjack. Makeup, of course, has been on Connorâ€™s agenda, but sheâ€™s still perfecting her techniqueâ€¦ Marnie has been cruisinâ€™ the streets of Novato looking for tiny dogs with short legs to bark at â€” that is, when Connor isnâ€™t demanding that they play dress-up together. Weâ€™ve all been enjoying this joyful break before Thanksgiving. I hope things are going well with you, too. Weâ€™re here and weâ€™re feisty (just tired). ðŸ˜Š Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 839 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
